task_summary: Perceive a pink cloth, approach, align and press to create a crease, then push to fold the cloth and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A single PR2 arm operates on a tabletop with a pink cloth. The goal is to fold the cloth by pressing its surface and pushing along a direction to create a crease, rather than grasping. The sequence emphasizes perception, precise alignment, gentle contact, and a controlled push. The gripper stays open and oriented at 90° to present a flat surface for pressing. Timeouts and short distances reflect careful, precise motion appropriate for deformable manipulation.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the cloth
Camera view available for cloth detection
stepwise_plan: Move above the cloth and orient the tool to 90°
Align to the cloth edge/crease line
Lower until contact to pin the cloth
Push left by 0.1 m to form a fold
success_criteria: A visible crease or partial fold is produced
Cloth remains on table without slipping away
No collision with table edges or robot body
Arm retreats to a safe hover
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry detection up to 3 times
If contact not detected, lower again with limited depth
If push slips, re-align and repeat push
If timeouts occur, abort and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Behavior ends after retreating and hovering above the cloth following the push.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool is aligned and close to the cloth, indicating imminent contact and crease formation.
frame_3.predicts_next: A push action to create the fold is expected immediately after contact.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open for pressing rather than grasping.
Verify the detected cloth remains visible.
Move to a safe pre-contact height above the cloth.
Orient tool to use the flat jaw surface for pressing.
Planar alignment to the fold line with tight tolerance.
Gently press the cloth against the table to pin it.
Push left to create the fold.
Back off to clear the workspace.
Return to hover above the cloth.

failure_modes: Over-pressing causing wrinkles away from desired fold
recovery_strategy: Re-orient yaw and re-align with tight tolerance
Abort and retreat on repeated timeouts
assumptions: Folding is achieved via press-and-push with a single arm (no grasp).
Push direction set to 180° (left) based on frames; exact crease line inferred from cloth orientation.
No explicit force control port available beyond LowerUntilContact's threshold.
